page.title: 17FARMING
page.content: {CROPS}grown in this block are for animal feed and for cash sales.{ {TURNIPS}are grown to feed sheep in winter,and{GRASS}is stored as hay or silage.Silage pits have become an increasingly common feature in recent years.{BARLEY}is a main crop in our block,being used for feeding stock, or the better yields sold for malting to the brewers and distillers.The straw from the barley is baled to use as bedding.Contractors with Combine Harvesters are hired when needed,and tractors with round or square balers are owned by the farms. The summer of 1985,this year of our survey,has been the wettest in living memory and many farmers have suffered heavy losses. Although no-one in this block has gone out of business, many others elsewhere have.
